review_blob: Really nice beer.  I am not a big fan of the regular black hole but the rum barrel is a great device.  Aroma is vanilla, honey, dark fruit, and choc.  Appearance in black with a tan head.  Taste is fruity, honey, a little rum, and coffee on the back end.  Palate is nice and creamy.
beer_name: Mikkeller Black Hole Barrel Aged Edition Rum

review_blob: I think I just came to understand the mikkeller hype.  After a number of disappointing stouts from them, this brew hits mark.  Aroma is coffee with dark fruit.  Appearance is black with a small tan head.  Taste is coffee, chocolate and maybe a little raisin.  Palate is very smooth with a little bit of almost chalky dryness.  Real nice beer.

I was very underwhelmed by this beer.  Aroma is very cherry apple with maybe some cheesy hints.  Color is a nut brown with no head.  Taste is very apple with some barnyard hints and something weird that must come from the barrel.  Palate is very thin and flat, and this kind of ruins the beer for me.
beer_name: BFM Abbaye de Saint Bon-Chien Grand Cru (2008) - Trousseau Barrel

review_blob: I dont really think Lager when I drink this beer, but is a nice (and fairly priced) session beer.  Aroma is bitter hops with hints of honey.  Appearance is a pale orange with minimal head.  Taste is bitter on the front with a honey and malt finish.  Palate is full bodied.  Nice beer.

Really nice porter.  The smoke is not huge anywhere.  The nose is espresso and chocolate.  Color is black is  a light head. Taste is coffee, chocolate and hints of smoke.  Palate is very smooth and full bodied.

Cellar aged for a year at hoppin frog then about six more months on my part.  This one of my absolute favorite Impys.  Aroma is chocolate and raisin.  Appearance is black with a thin tan head.  Taste is chocolate, oatmeal, and raisin.  Palate is thick and smooth.

Can courtesy of Wavers1. Really nice IPA.  The malts are strongest on the nose with hints of honey and grassy hops.  Color is a dark amber with robust white head an good lacing.  Taste is very hoppy (the 100 IBUs come through)  grass and herbal hints with a nice malt backbone.  Palate is nice and creamy.

100th rate!  I have been saving this for now.  Aroma is chocolate, dark fruit, and a bit of alcohal.  Appearance is jet with almost no tan head.  Taste is strong with alcohol, dark fruit and chocolate.  Palate is a bit oily nice beer!

I think deep down I just like APA more than EPA.  It has a strong malt backbone.  The aroma is is honey and little hop input.  Appeance is a light amber with white head.  Taste is honey and caramel with a little bitterness.  Palate is very rich and creamy.  Decent enough brew but not my cup of tea.

pretty nice Saison, but there are a lot better ones out there.  Aroma is hay with some light apple elements.  Appearance is a light amber with a white head and nice lacing.  Taste is vanilla and apple.  Palate  is dry but a bit creamy.  A decent saison.

I am enjoying the hell out of this beer.  I suppose it counts broadly as a saison but who really cares.  There are hints of the rustic barny scents of the yeast, but it is dominated by the fresh herbal nose from the parsley, sage, etc.  Color is very pale with a thin white head.  Taste is incredibly refreshing with a punch in the tounge from the parsley and sage and a little citrus hint on the back end.  Palate is very clean and dry.  Great beer.
beer_name: Stone / Dogfish Head / Victory Saison du BUFF

review_blob: This beer is good but its not better than the sum of its parts.  Aroma is light acidic hints with cherries and apples.  Appearance is a deep brown with off-white head and good lacing.  Taste is a week acidity with Apples, peach, and maybe some cherry.  Palate is very rich and creamy.  Nice sour brown ale but I would La Folie or Haandbaak over it any time and both are cheaper.

I am really enjoying this brew.  Aroma is dominated lemon and grass with a hint of alcohol.  Appearance is a pale yellow like lemon juice and minimal head.  Taste is lemon and vanilla.  Palate is a bit thin and refreshing.  Really nice beer.

Highly drinkable and tastelist.  Aroma is some faint hints of hay and water.  Color is fizzy and yellow.  Taste is carbonated water, not much else, maybe a hint of banana.  Palate is ultra dry.  All of this implies a terrible drinking experience but it will get you messed up.

Nice brew and well worth the little price tag (I think $3.50 for a bomber).  Aroma is hay, cheese and citrus appearance is a very clear pale with ample white head.  Taste is earthy with almost a soapy quality and hints of lemon.  Palate is very crisp and light.  Would drink again.

375 ml bottle.  Wish I could figure out the vintage.  Aroma is very tart wit hhints of barnyard and cheese.  color is very pale with a white head an good lacing.  Taste is cheesy on the front with with a very tart finnish with apple-tu[e fruits.  Palate  is very crisp and clean.  Really nice beer.  Beginning to solidify Gueze as my favorite sour style.

Another brew in my exploration of saison, a style I have really come to love.  The brett is subtle, it adds a little earthiness to the sweet lemon  and malt of the saison.  Color is pale amber with a white head.  Palate is rich and creamy!
Great brew!

Really nice IPA.  Aroma is strong bitterness and tropical fruit.  Color is pale yellow with a fluffy white head.  Flavor is tropical with a strong malt backbone.  Palate is a bit thinner than I would like on a double IPA.

Aroma is honey with some bitter notes.  Appearance is a lite caramel with decent lacing.  Taste is malty caramel backbone but with a strong bitterness.  Palate is crisp and clean!  Another nice (although not incredibly exciting) beer from this promising new brewery.

Thanks a lot for this one Baker.  750 ml bottle from 2009 I have been wanting to try it for a while.  Aroma is maybe some tart apple and maybe hints of cherry.  Color is pale amber with minimal head.  Taste is hay and apple with hints of the brett character but its more subdued than I expected.  Palate is dry and refreshing.

Courtesy of some very nice people.  Color is an cloudy yellow with a huge white head.  Aroma is hay and grass.  Taste is tough to pin down.  Maybe some ginger and vanilla and something I just cant put my finger on.  Palate is very crisp and dry.

I am starting to understand why sierra nevadas reputation is so good.  Nose is dominated by the yeast with a strong cheese aroma and hints of hay.  Color is pale and cloudy with a fluffy white head.  Taste is citrus and hints of spice from the hops. Palate is very clean and full bodied.

Aroma has hints of chocolate and heavy maltiness.  Color is a deep brown with a tan head.  Taste is coco with a nice bitterness.  Palate is a bit thinner than I would prefer but I have to remind myself this is not an impy.

After hearing that Anchor was bought.  I figured it was my duty to try all their brews just in case and man am i glad.  I had Anchor Steam plenty before and enjoyed it, but I had not had it since becoming a beer nerd. Now Liberty Ale is up.   This is really and IPA.  Its much hoppier than your average APA.  Nose is pine, sages, and maybe almost hints of mint.  Appearance is a pale orange.  Taste is a bit malty on the front but a very bitter finish with hints of pine and citrus.  Palate is full and creamy.

This beer is terrible.  I like the occasional PBR but I have always hated high life.  It is not even good for cooking brats.  Aroma is nonexsistent.  Head is about an inch.  Taste is akin to a glass of perrier mixed with poison.  Palate is far too dry.  Bad, bad, Bad!

This is my first mead ever, and its really tasty.  Aroma is honey, apricot, and maybe some hints of vanilla.  Color is a pale gold.  Taste is butterscotch, big apricot and hint of alcohol.  Palate is very clean.  Would like to try more meads.

Really nice pilsner courtesy of Wavers1.  It goes "imperial" without loosing whats great about a a pils.  Aroma is dominated by the yeast with hints of barnyard and cheese.  Appearence is very pale with a fluffy white head and good lacing.  Taste is very clean but with a nice hop bitterness on the end.    Palate is very crisp and clean.  Nice brew.

Certainly an above average impy, maybe the bitterest I have had.  Aroma is dark fruit and molasses.  Appearance is jet black with a thin tan head.  Taste is incredibly bitter and chocolate.  Palate is a little thinner than I would like but still great.

Courtesy of Wavers1 for this brew.  Aroma is a strong malty honey backbone, with hints of citrus hops.  Color is a pale orange, with about two fingers of white head.  Taste has a bigger Malt Backbone than most IPAs with hints of honey, bitter hops, and and grapefruit.  Palate is crisp and thin.

I like Terrapin a lot but this does not seem right.  The aroma is great heavy on the grape fruit and citrus.  Color is a dark amber.  taste is heavy on the grapefruit.  The failure is in the palate, it fells very flat and watery.  I fear the keg may have been bad.  This cant be right, because the rye pale ale is so good.

Nice little IPA.  Aroma is grass, flowers, and maybe a little pine.  Appearance is an amber orange two fingers of fluffy white head.  Taste is very bitter with hints of citrus and floral, but an nice little malt backbone.  The brew is crisp and dry.

Decent triple but obviously doesnt fit style.  Aroma is faint but I picked up hints of dark fruit and maybe honey.  Color is more like a quad than a triple but dryness is much closer to the style.  Taste is brown sugar and dark fruit with a nice alcohol kick.

nice brew.  Aroma is reminiscent of a pinot noire, grapes with hint of light acidity.  Appearance is a mahogany with small head.  Flavor is butter, grapes, and an almost bready character.   Palate is very rich and creamy.  Would drink again for sure.

Aroma is grass with hints of citrus (I assume from the Amarillo).  Appearance is a pale amber with white head.  Taste is  citrus hops with a nice malt backbone.  Palate is rich almost sticky. Good pale ale.

Delicious brew.  I first encountered Steam Beer in the page of Frank Norriss McTeague, and despite the fact that the book ends with two men handcuffed together and ripping each other apart in the middle of the desert, I still wanted to try steam Beer.  Aroma is bitter hops and almost earthen.  Color is a pale amber with a nice little head.  Taste is grass and maybe a little licorice.  Palate is light and dry.  Great, classic brew.

I dont know why people arent talking about haandbryggeriet more often, because they once again hit the nail on the head for me.  Nose is dark chocolate, wheat and the old alcohol.  Color is black with a tan head that quickly dissipates.  Taste is chocolate, dark fruit, licorice, and roast.  Palate is a bit thinner and a bit drier maybe the impact of the wheat.  Great beer.  Hopefully this brewery starts getting their deserved credit.

Aroma is wheat, banana and honey.  Color is a amber honey with good lacing and persistent white head.  Taste is big with the banana flavor plus a little honey and clotted cream.  Palate is very smooth and well bodied not too dry at all.  Great brew

This gives me pretty decent hopes for this brewery and definitely wanna give the pale ale a try.  Aroma is fruity bubble gum, juicy fruit is.  Color is a nice red with a head that will dissipate relatively soon.  Taste is bubble gum, apple, and maybe a little cherry.  Palate is crisp and very clean.

This is a very nice representative of what Sweet Water really does well, classic well balanced beers conforming to traditional styles.  It is a tough job and rarely gets much credit but damn it can be nice.  Aroma is pure hay, smells like the farm.  Color is very pale with good lacing.  Taste is very crisp and well balanced with hints of caramel and hay.  Palate is very well rounded and hay.

750 ml bottle.  Aroma is sweet apple and a little hint of spicy hops.  Appearance is a pale orange with a persistant white head, good lacing.  Taste is almost like a cider, balanced with a nice light hoppy bitterness.  Palate is very dry.

Bottled December 2009.  Smell is dark coco and vanilla. Color is black with mocha colored head and good lacing.  Taste us roasty coco and coffee.  Palate is thick and smooth almost like milk.  Fantastic.
Great beer one of the essential first shots at a sour.  Aroma is cherry  Color is mahagony with a little lacing.  Taste is sour.  Creamy palate.

Best Quad I have ever had.  On the nose, grapes punch you in the face.  Additionally there are nice of dark fruit.  Color is a dark brown with a fluffy white head.  Taste is grape/ raisin.  palate is smooth with persistant carbonation.

2008 vintage.  I would describe this as an about averagge imperial stout.  Good but not one of my favorites.  At first whiff aroma is alcohal, but as it heats up, I can taste choclate, raisin and other dank fruit.  Appearance is engine oil  with a small tan head but nice lacing.  Taste chocolate, raisin and roast.  Palate is very smooth and a little lighter than one would expect for an impy.  Pretty good brew.

This beer is drinking incredilby well.  It is impeccably balanced.  Aroma is minimal with hints of caramel.  Appearance is amber with stagnant carbonation.  Taste is malt forward balanced by a slight hop bitterness with strong caramel notes.  Palate is very smooth and dry.  Great beer.

This is type of beer I come to expect from highland, incredibly well balacned and traditional beer great for sitting back and k.o.ing a few.  Aroma is honey and bitter hop.  Color is pale orange with persistent white head.  The beer is malt forward with a a nice bitter punch at the end.  Palate is thin and dry but very smooth.
Appearance is black with a small pale head.  Aroma is incredible dark chocolate.  Flavor is chocolate and dark fruit.  A little light on the mouthfeel for an Impy.

One of the few lambics Available at Retail and AL, and it is a poor example of the style.  Aroma is sweet dominated by cherry and 7-up.  Taste is sugary sweet with no sour and only the slightest hint of barnyard.  Palate is a nice dry and is about the only fulfilled expectation of a Kriek.

Watching Jesus camp, working from home, and getting fucked up.  This beer is incredibly bitter for an IRS.   Aroma is bitter cocoa and hints of maybe dried fruit.  Appearance is black with a a finger of off white head.  Side Note:  Warlock are enemies of God and in the Old Testiment Harry Potter would have bee put to Death (lady from Jesus Camp).  Taste is bitter Cocoa with strong alcohol hints.  Damn it, this is just a punch in the tongue.  Its good but I think they went a little too far on the hops.  Their is a blond kid  sobbing on the TV for Jesus.  Palate is thin and oily for an impy.
beer_name: Smuttynose Big Beer Series: Imperial Stout

review_blob: I am enjoying this beer a lot.  Aroma is coco and coffee.  Appearance is black with about two fingers of tan head.  Taste is coffee and roast.  Palate is very smooth and full bodied.
